metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9261 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.4.0 to 2.4.5 and 2.2.0 to 2.2.13, the NBAP dissector could crash with a large loop that ends with a heap-based buffer overflow. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-nbap.c by prohibiting the self-linking of DCH-IDs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1').
